subject: Learning
title: Object Permanence: Out of Sight, Out of Mind
description: A quick win: understand Object Permanence: Out of Sight, Out of Mind.

hook.text: Hide a toy under a blanket and a six-month-old thinks it's gone forever. To them, it ceased to exist.

discovery.text: Piaget saw this as a landmark of the sensorimotor stage, marking the beginning of mental representation.

twist.text: Newer research using eye-tracking shows babies may grasp object permanence earlier than Piaget believedâ€”around 3 months.

climax.text: The gap suggests babies know more than they can demonstrate. Their knowledge outpaces their motor skills.

punchline.text: Babies know more than they show. We underestimate the infant mind.
